law.catch_line: Other persons not to install sanitation improvements without approval -- Violation is nuisance.
law.text: After the establishment of the district and the organization of the board of directors, no person or public corporation shall install within the district any laterals, trunk lines, interceptors for the collection or discharge of sewage or other liquid waste, treatment or disposal works, until the plans therefor have been submitted to and approved by the board of directors of the district and the Energy and Environment Cabinet. Any installation contrary to the provisions of this section shall constitute a nuisance and shall be abated by injunction upon proper application by anyone aggrieved, including the district, the commissioner, or the Energy and Environment Cabinet.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 332, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. III, sec. 13(2). -- Amended 1972 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 3, sec. 34. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2062g-26.
